intro: Gustavia membrillo, commonly known as the yellow hibiscus, is a tropical shrub native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, yellow-orange flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and has palmate leaves with a smooth, waxy surface. Its flowers bloom in clusters and are often visited by bees and other pollinators. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, round seeds.
